label: Low Back Pain
annotation: "lombo-sciatique" in French texts is indexed here (IM) +SCIATICA(IM)
scope_note: Acute or chronic pain in the lumbar or sacral regions, which may be associated with musculo-ligamentousSPRAINS AND STRAINS;INTERVERTEBRAL DISK DISPLACEMENT; and other conditions.

label: Cancer Pain
annotation: not for treatment-related pain
scope_note: Pain that may be caused by or related to cellular, tissue, and systemic changes that occur duringNEOPLASMgrowth, tissue invasion, andMETASTASIS.

label: Chronic Pain
annotation: differentiate fromPAIN, INTRACTABLE
scope_note: Aching sensation that persists for more than a few months. It may or may not be associated with trauma or disease, and may persist after the initial injury has healed. Its localization, character, and timing are more vague than with acute pain.

label: Flank Pain
scope_note: Pain emanating from below theRIBSand above theILIUM.

label: Labor Pain
scope_note: Pain associated withOBSTETRIC LABORinCHILDBIRTH. It is caused primarily byUTERINE CONTRACTIONas well as pressure on theCERVIX;BLADDER; and theGASTROINTESTINAL TRACT. Labor pain mostly occurs in theABDOMEN; theGROIN; and theBACK.

label: Mastodynia
scope_note: Pain in the breast generally classified as cyclical (associated with menstrual periods), or noncyclical, i.e. originating from the breast or nearby muscles or joints, ranging from minor discomfort to severely incapacitating.

label: Pelvic Girdle Pain
scope_note: Discomfort associated with the bones that make up the pelvic girdle. It occurs frequently during pregnancy.

label: Neck Pain
scope_note: Discomfort or more intense forms of pain that are localized to the cervical region. This term generally refers to pain in the posterior or lateral regions of the neck.

label: Visceral Pain
scope_note: Pain originating from internal organs (VISCERA) associated with autonomic phenomena (PALLOR;SWEATING;NAUSEA; andVOMITING). It often becomes aREFERRED PAIN.

label: Pain, Intractable
annotation: usually chronic, so do not coordinate withCHRONIC PAIN
scope_note: Persistent pain that is refractory to some or all forms of treatment.

label: Pain, Procedural
scope_note: Pain associated with examination, treatment or procedures.

label: Pain, Referred
annotation: coordinate with specific pain term if pertinent
scope_note: A type of pain that is perceived in an area away from the site where the pain arises, such as facial pain caused by lesion of theVAGUS NERVE, or throat problem generating referred pain in the ear.

label: Renal Colic
scope_note: A severe intermittent and spasmodic pain in the lower back radiating to the groin, scrotum, and labia which is most commonly caused by a kidney stone (RENAL CALCULUS) passing through theURETERor by other urinary track blockage. It is often associated with nausea, vomiting, fever, restlessness, dull pain, frequent urination, andHEMATURIA.

label: Psychophysiologic Disorders
annotation: differentiate fromPSYCHOSOMATIC MEDICINEwhich is the field; coord IM with specific dis/‌psychol(IM); Manual 27.12
scope_note: A group of disorders characterized by physical symptoms that are affected by emotional factors and involve a single organ system, usually underAUTONOMIC NERVOUS SYSTEMcontrol. (American Psychiatric Glossary, 1988)

label: Dizziness
annotation: differentiate fromVERTIGO, illusion of revolution in space, but use word of text
scope_note: An imprecise term which may refer to a sense of spatial disorientation, motion of the environment, or lightheadedness.

label: Oral Hemorrhage
annotation: not hemorrh from the mouth but hemorrh of oral tissue; do not confuse withBLEEDING ON PROBING, GINGIVALseePERIODONTAL INDEX
scope_note: Bleeding from the blood vessels of the mouth, which may occur as a result of injuries to the mouth, accidents in oral surgery, or diseases of the gums.

label: Prodromal Symptoms
scope_note: Clinical or physiological indicators that precede the onset of disease.

label: Pseudophakia
annotation: do not confuse withPSEUDOAPHAKIAseeCATARACT
scope_note: Presence of an intraocular lens after cataract extraction.

label: Reticulocytosis
scope_note: An increase in circulatingRETICULOCYTES, which is among the simplest and most reliable signs of acceleratedERYTHROCYTEproduction. Reticulocytosis occurs during activeBLOODregeneration (stimulation of red bone marrow) and in certain types ofANEMIA, particularlyCONGENITAL HEMOLYTIC ANEMIA.

label: Anorexia
annotation: ANOREXIA NERVOSAis also available
scope_note: The lack or loss ofAPPETITEaccompanied by an aversion to food and the inability to eat. It is the defining characteristic of the disorderANOREXIA NERVOSA.

label: Opioid-Induced Constipation
scope_note: CONSTIPATIONassociated with the use ofOPIOIDS.

label: Diarrhea, Infantile
annotation: human only; don't forget infant check tags as pertinent
scope_note: DIARRHEAoccurring in infants from newborn to 24-months old.

label: Dyspepsia
scope_note: Impaired digestion, especially after eating.

label: Encopresis
annotation: of psychological origin: differentiate fromFECAL INCONTINENCE, of organic origin
scope_note: Incontinence of feces not due to organic defect or illness.

label: Eructation
scope_note: The ejection of gas or air through the mouth from the stomach.

label: Flatulence
annotation: /drug ther: consider alsoANTIFOAMING AGENTS; see note on "intestinal gases" underGASES
scope_note: Production or presence of gas in the gastrointestinal tract which may be expelled through the anus.

label: Food Intolerance
scope_note: Digestive system disorder where a particular food irritates the digestive tract or cannot be properly digested (i.e., due to a lack of a digestive enzyme). It differs fromFOOD HYPERSENSITIVITYwhich is an immune system disorder, usually due to specific proteins in food.  http://my.clevelandclinic.org/health/articles/problem-foods-is-it-an-allergy-or-intolerance.

label: Gagging
scope_note: Contraction of the muscle of thePHARYNXcaused by stimulation of sensory receptors on theSOFT PALATE, by psychic stimuli, or systemically by drugs.

label: Halitosis
scope_note: An offensive, foul breath odor resulting from a variety of causes such as poor oral hygiene, dental or oral infections, or the ingestion of certain foods.

label: Heartburn
scope_note: Substernal pain or burning sensation, usually associated with regurgitation of gastric juice into the esophagus.

label: Hiccup
scope_note: A spasm of the diaphragm that causes a sudden inhalation followed by rapid closure of the glottis which produces a sound.

label: Bulimia
annotation: BULIMIA NERVOSAis also available
scope_note: Eating an excess amount of food in a short period of time, as seen in the disorder ofBULIMIA NERVOSA. It is caused by an abnormal craving for food, or insatiable hunger also known as ox hunger.

label: Pica
scope_note: The persistent eating of non-nutritive substances for a period of at least one month.

label: Apnea
annotation: do not confuseAPNEAwith other resp disord: use only when text usesAPNEA; apnea neonatorum =APNEA+ check tagsINFANT, NEWBORN+HUMAN
scope_note: A transient absence of spontaneous respiration.

label: Hypercapnia
annotation: CARBON DIOXIDE/blood is also available
scope_note: A clinical manifestation of abnormal increase in the amount of carbon dioxide in arterial blood.

label: Hyperoxia
annotation: restrict to dis or clin state in humans or higher animals: do not confuse with hyperoxic state in lower animals or micro-organisms ( =OXYGENorAEROBIOSIS); do not confuse withHYPOXIAseeHYPOXIA
scope_note: An abnormal increase in the amount of oxygen in the tissues and organs.

label: Hyperventilation
annotation: respiratory, not environmental; hyperventilation syndrome: coord IM with/‌psychol+ emotional aspect (IM or NIM)
scope_note: A pulmonary ventilation rate faster than is metabolically necessary for the exchange of gases. It is the result of an increased frequency of breathing, an increased tidal volume, or a combination of both. It causes an excess intake of oxygen and the blowing off of carbon dioxide.

label: Hypocapnia
annotation: CARBON DIOXIDE/blood is also available
scope_note: Clinical manifestation consisting of a deficiency of carbon dioxide in arterial blood.

label: Hypoventilation
annotation: respiratory, not environmental
scope_note: A reduction in the amount of air entering the pulmonary alveoli.

label: Snoring
annotation: note category
scope_note: Rough, noisy breathing during sleep, due to vibration of the uvula and soft palate.

label: Sneezing
scope_note: The sudden, forceful, involuntary expulsion of air from theNOSEandMOUTHcaused by irritation to theMUCOUS MEMBRANESof the upperRESPIRATORY TRACT.

label: Cellulite
scope_note: Skin lumpiness or skin surface dimpling often seen on the thighs, buttocks and abdomen. It is due to protrusion ofSUBCUTANEOUS FATinto theDERMISlayer of skin.

label: Flushing
annotation: do not confuse withBLUSHINGorHOT FLASHES
scope_note: A transient reddening of the face that may be due to fever, certain drugs, exertion, or stress.

label: Pallor
scope_note: A clinical manifestation consisting of an unnatural paleness of the skin.

label: Striae Distensae
scope_note: Linear dermal scars accompanied by epidermal atrophy that affects skin that is subjected to continuous stretching. They usually do not cause any significant medical problems, only cosmetic problems.

label: Sleepiness
scope_note: Compelling urge to sleep.

label: Crystalluria
scope_note: Crystals in theURINEfound in urinary sediment analysis. Urinary crystalline may be formed from various metabolites (e.g.,CALCIUMOXALATES;CALCIUMPHOSPHATES; URATES) and drugs (e.g.,SULPHADIAZINE;ACYCLOVIR; andTRIAMTERENE).

label: Hypercalciuria
scope_note: Excretion of abnormally high level ofCALCIUMin theURINE, greater than 4 mg/kg/day.

label: Dysuria
scope_note: PainfulURINATION. It is often associated with infections of the lowerURINARY TRACT.

label: Nocturia
scope_note: FrequentURINATIONat night that interrupts sleep. It is often associated with outflow obstruction,DIABETES MELLITUS, or bladder inflammation (CYSTITIS).

label: Urinoma
scope_note: An encapsulated accumulation ofURINEin the retroperitoneal area. It has the appearance of a cyst (CYSTS). Urinoma is usually caused byURETERAL OBSTRUCTION, renal trauma or perforation of the renal collecting system.

label: High Pressure Neurological Syndrome
annotation: in divers; do not confuse withINERT GAS NARCOSIS
scope_note: A syndrome related to increased atmospheric pressure and characterized by tremors, nausea, dizziness, decreased motor and mental performance, andSEIZURES. This condition may occur in those who dive deeply (c. 1000 ft) usually while breathing a mixture of oxygen and helium. The condition is associated with a neuroexcitatory effect of helium.

label: Inert Gas Narcosis
annotation: IM; specify gas (IM)
scope_note: Progressive mental disturbances and unconsciousness due to breathing mixtures of oxygen and inert gases (argon, helium, xenon, krypton, and atmospheric nitrogen) at high pressure.

label: Burnout, Professional
scope_note: An excessive stress reaction to one's occupational or professional environment. It may be characterized by feelings of emotional and physical exhaustion, coupled with a sense of frustration and failure.

label: Persian Gulf Syndrome
annotation: coord IM with specific dis or manifest (IM)
scope_note: Unexplained symptoms reported by veterans of the Persian Gulf War with Iraq in 1991. The symptoms reported include fatigue, skin rash, muscle and joint pain, headaches, loss of memory, shortness of breath, gastrointestinal and respiratory symptoms, and extreme sensitivity to commonly occurring chemicals. (Nature 1994 May 5;369(6475):8)

label: Anticholinergic Syndrome
scope_note: Adverse drug effects associated withCHOLINERGIC ANTAGONISTS. Clinical features includeTACHYCARDIA;HYPERTHERMIA;MYDRIASIS, dry skin and dry mucous membranes, decreased bowel sounds and urinary retention in peripheral anticholinergic syndrome; andHALLUCINATIONS;PSYCHOSES;SEIZURES; andCOMAin central anticholinergic syndrome.

label: Chemotherapy-Related Cognitive Impairment
scope_note: The diminished or impaired mental and/or intellectual function associated with the chemical treatment of cancer.

label: Metabolic Side Effects of Drugs and Substances
annotation: used for searching; INDEXER: Do not use; CATALOGER: Do not use
scope_note: Specific effects of drugs and substances on metabolic pathways such as those occurring through theCYTOCHROME P-450 ENZYME SYSTEM. These include effects that often result inDRUG INTERACTIONS;FOOD-DRUG INTERACTIONS; andHERB-DRUG INTERACTIONS.

label: Serotonin Syndrome
scope_note: An adverse drug interaction characterized by altered mental status, autonomic dysfunction, and neuromuscular abnormalities. It is most frequently caused by use of both serotonin reuptake inhibitors and monoamine oxidase inhibitors, leading to excess serotonin availability in the CNS at the serotonin 1A receptor.

label: Insect Bites and Stings
scope_note: Bites and stings inflicted by insects.

label: Scorpion Stings
scope_note: The effects, both local and systemic, caused by the bite ofSCORPIONS.

label: Snake Bites
annotation: Coordinate IM with specific snake family or genus (IM); therapy with antivenins is/‌ther, not/‌drug ther
scope_note: Bites by snakes. Bite by a venomous snake is characterized by stinging pain at the wound puncture. The venom injected at the site of the bite is capable of producing a deleterious effect on the blood or on the nervous system. (Webster's 3d ed; from Dorland, 27th ed, at snake, venomous)

label: Spider Bites
scope_note: The effects, both local and systemic, caused by the bites ofSPIDERS.

label: Tick Paralysis
annotation: paralysis caused by tick bite; see note underTICKS
scope_note: Paralysis caused by a neurotropic toxin secreted by the salivary glands of ticks.

label: Carbon Tetrachloride Poisoning
scope_note: Poisoning that results from ingestion, injection, inhalation, or skin absorption ofCARBON TETRACHLORIDE.

label: Fluoride Poisoning
annotation: coordinate with specific fluoride compound/‌poisif pertinent
scope_note: Poisoning that results from chronic or acute ingestion, injection, inhalation, or skin absorption ofFLUORIDEcompounds.

label: Ciguatera Poisoning
scope_note: Poisoning caused by ingestion ofSEAFOODcontaining microgram levels ofCIGUATOXINS. The poisoning is characterized by gastrointestinal, neurological and cardiovascular disturbances.

label: Mushroom Poisoning
annotation: = pois by mushroom toxins; TN 133: relation to food pois from canned mushrooms
scope_note: Poisoning from ingestion of mushrooms, primarily from, but not restricted to, toxic varieties.

label: Shellfish Poisoning
annotation: coordinate with specific shellfish if pertinent
scope_note: Poisoning from toxins present in bivalve mollusks that have been ingested. Four distinct types of shellfish poisoning are recognized based on the toxin involved.

label: Carbon Monoxide Poisoning
scope_note: Toxic asphyxiation due to the displacement of oxygen from oxyhemoglobin by carbon monoxide.

label: Cadmium Poisoning
annotation: occup cadmium pois: coord IM withOCCUPATIONAL DISEASES(IM) but not alsoENVIRONMENTAL EXPOSURE(see note there)
scope_note: Poisoning occurring after exposure to cadmium compounds or fumes. It may cause gastrointestinal syndromes, anemia, or pneumonitis.

label: Ergotism
scope_note: Poisoning caused by ingesting ergotized grain or by the misdirected or excessive use of ergot as a medicine.

label: Organophosphate Poisoning
annotation: coordinate with specific organophosphate if pertinent
scope_note: Poisoning due to exposure toORGANOPHOSPHORUS COMPOUNDS, such asORGANOPHOSPHATES;ORGANOTHIOPHOSPHATES; andORGANOTHIOPHOSPHONATES.

label: Lathyrism
scope_note: A paralytic condition of the legs caused by ingestion of lathyrogens, especiallyBETA-AMINOPROPIONITRILEor beta-N-oxalyl amino-L-alanine, which are found in the seeds of plants of the genusLATHYRUS.

label: Psychoses, Alcoholic
scope_note: A group of mental disorders associated with organic brain damage and caused by poisoning from alcohol.

label: Alcoholic Intoxication
annotation: human & animal
scope_note: An acute brain syndrome which results from the excessive ingestion ofETHANOLorALCOHOLIC BEVERAGES.

label: Alcoholism
annotation: human and animal; note entry termALCOHOLIC INTOXICATION, CHRONIC: do not coordinate withCHRONIC DISEASE; available also are BINGE DRINKING, DRUNKENNESS seeALCOHOLIC INTOXICATIONandALCOHOLICS; acute alcoholic intoxication =ETHANOL/pois; consider alsoALCOHOL-INDUCED DISORDERSand specifics; index other complications of alcoholism underALCOHOLISM/‌compl+ disease/‌etiolnot/‌chem ind; abstinence from alcohol in alcoholism: coordinate withTEMPERANCE
scope_note: A primary, chronic disease with genetic, psychosocial, and environmental factors influencing its development and manifestations. The disease is often progressive and fatal. It is characterized by impaired control over drinking, preoccupation with the drug alcohol, use of alcohol despite adverse consequences, and distortions in thinking, most notably denial. Each of these symptoms may be continuous or periodic. (Morse & Flavin for the Joint Commission of the National Council on Alcoholism and Drug Dependence and the American Society of Addiction Medicine to Study the Definition and Criteria for the Diagnosis of Alcoholism: in JAMA 1992;268:1012-4)

label: Binge Drinking
scope_note: Drinking an excessive amount ofALCOHOLIC BEVERAGESin a short period of time.

label: Amphetamine-Related Disorders
scope_note: Disorders related or resulting from use of amphetamines.

label: Cocaine-Related Disorders
scope_note: Disorders related or resulting from use of cocaine.

label: Opiate Overdose
scope_note: Accidental or deliberate use of anOPIOIDin excess of normal dosage. It includes overdose for prescription and illicit opioids.

label: Inhalant Abuse
scope_note: Illicit use of chemicals and products whose vapors can be inhaled to produce a rapid mind-altering effect. Inhalants include aerosols, gases, and volatile solvents that are often inhaled repeatedly to achieve the short-lived intoxicating effect.

label: Heroin Dependence
scope_note: Strong dependence or addiction, both physiological and emotional, uponHEROIN.

label: Morphine Dependence
annotation: HEROIN DEPENDENCEis also available
scope_note: Strong dependence, both physiological and emotional, upon morphine.

label: Opium Dependence
scope_note: Strong physiological and emotional dependence onOPIUM.

label: Psychoses, Substance-Induced
annotation: PSYCHOSES, ALCOHOLICis available
scope_note: Psychotic organic mental disorders resulting from the toxic effect of drugs and chemicals or other harmful substance.

label: Substance Abuse, Intravenous
annotation: IM + specific drug or substance IM (without qualif); for "abuse, overuse or misuse"
scope_note: Abuse, overuse, or misuse of a substance by its injection into a vein.

label: Substance Abuse, Oral
scope_note: Abuse, overuse, or misuse of a substance by ingestion.

label: Tobacco Use Disorder
annotation: includes cigarettes, cigars, chewing tobacco & snuff; a psychiatric diagnosis: do not confuse withSMOKING/‌adv eff; note entry termNICOTINE DEPENDENCE: do not coordinate withNICOTINEunless nicotine is substantially discussed as a chemical
scope_note: Tobacco used to the detriment of a person's health or social functioning. Tobacco dependence is included.

label: Accidental Injuries
scope_note: Injuries resulting from events or circumstances that are unforeseen, unplanned, unanticipated, and without premeditation.

label: Multiple Amputations, Traumatic
annotation: by accident or injury; do not confuse withMULTIPLE AMPUTATION, SURGICAL(seeAMPUTATION, SURGICAL), a surgical procedure;/‌surg: consider alsoREPLANTATION
scope_note: The loss of part of, or all of, more than one limb, or other appendages of the body due to injury or disease.

label: Humeral Fractures, Distal
scope_note: Fractures of the distalHUMERUSat theELBOW JOINT.

label: Olecranon Fracture
scope_note: Fractures of theOLECRANON PROCESSat theELBOW JOINT.

label: Radial Head and Neck Fractures
scope_note: Fractures of the proximal head and/or neck of theRADIUSbone near theELBOW JOINT.

label: Elbow Tendinopathy
scope_note: Inflammation (tendinitis) or degeneration (tendinosis) of the tendons of the elbow.

label: Wrist Fractures
scope_note: Fractures of theCARPAL BONES, the distalULNAand/orRADIUSat theWRIST.

label: Athletic Injuries
annotation: general or unspecified; prefer specific sport/‌inj; when general, coordinate with specific injury; distinguish fromSPORTS MEDICINE;TENNIS ELBOWis available but see note there
scope_note: Injuries incurred during participation in competitive or non-competitive sports.

label: Spinal Fractures
annotation: coordinate with specific vertebrae/‌inj
scope_note: Broken bones in the vertebral column.

label: Blast Injuries
annotation: various body inj from waves of high-pressure velocity;/‌complpermitted but do not confuse with/‌pathol
scope_note: Injuries resulting when a person is struck by particles impelled with violent force from an explosion. Blast causes pulmonary concussion and hemorrhage, laceration of other thoracic and abdominal viscera, ruptured ear drums, and minor effects in the central nervous system. (From Dorland, 27th ed)

label: Decompression Sickness
scope_note: A condition occurring as a result of exposure to a rapid fall in ambient pressure. Gases, nitrogen in particular, come out of solution and form bubbles in body fluid and blood. These gas bubbles accumulate in joint spaces and the peripheral circulation impairing tissue oxygenation causing disorientation, severe pain, and potentially death.

label: Bites, Human
annotation: the human is biting, not being bitten; don't forget to check tagHUMANS
scope_note: Bites inflicted by humans.

label: Tick Bites
scope_note: The effects, both local and systemic, caused by the bites ofTICKS.

label: Burns, Chemical
annotation: chemical eye burns =BURNS, CHEMICAL(IM) +EYE BURNS/‌chem ind(IM)
scope_note: Burns caused by contact with or exposure toCAUSTICSor strongACIDS.

label: Burns, Electric
scope_note: Burns produced by contact with electric current or from a sudden discharge of electricity.

label: Smoke Inhalation Injury
annotation: BURNS, INHALATIONis also available
scope_note: Pulmonary injury following the breathing in of toxic smoke from burning materials such as plastics, synthetics, building materials, etc. This injury is the most frequent cause of death in burn patients.

label: Chilblains
scope_note: Recurrent localized itching, swelling and painful erythema on the fingers, toes or ears, produced by exposure to cold.

label: Crush Syndrome
scope_note: Severe systemic manifestation of trauma and ischemia involving soft tissues, principally skeletal muscle, due to prolonged severe crushing. It leads to increased permeability of the cell membrane and to the release of potassium, enzymes, and myoglobin from within cells. Ischemic renal dysfunction secondary to hypotension and diminished renal perfusion results in acute tubular necrosis and uremia.

label: Hip Dislocation
annotation: note entry termHIP DYSPLASIA:HIP DYSPLASIA, CANINEis also available
scope_note: Displacement of the femur bone from its normal position at theHIP JOINT.

label: Near Drowning
scope_note: Non-fatal immersion or submersion in water. The subject is resuscitable.

label: Conducted Energy Weapon Injuries
scope_note: The injuries caused by conducted energy weapons such as stun guns, shock batons, and cattle prods.

label: Esophageal Perforation
annotation: esophageal rupture does not go here: indexESOPHAGUS/‌inj(IM) +RUPTURE(NIM) orESOPHAGEAL DISEASES(IM) +RUPTURE, SPONTANEOUS(NIM)
scope_note: An opening or hole in theESOPHAGUSthat is caused byTRAUMA, injury, or pathological process.

label: Extravasation of Diagnostic and Therapeutic Materials
scope_note: The escape of diagnostic or therapeutic material from the vessel into which it is introduced into the surrounding tissue or body cavity.

label: Bezoars
annotation: concretions from ingested foreign matter; coord IM with organ (IM), not organ/dis: Manual 21.39
scope_note: Concretions of swallowed hair, fruit or vegetable fibers, or similar substances found in the alimentary canal.

label: Intrauterine Device Migration
scope_note: The shifting in position or location of anINTRAUTERINE DEVICEfrom its original placement.

label: Ankle Fractures
scope_note: Fractures of any of the bones of theANKLE.

label: Fibula Fractures
scope_note: Fractures of theFIBULA.

label: Fractures, Avulsion
scope_note: Tearing away of theCORTICAL BONEfragment at the location of a strong ligament or tendon attachment. The bone fragment detachment site often occurs near a soft site (e.g.,GROWTH PLATE) at the base whereLIGAMENTS;TENDONS; orJOINT CAPSULESattach. In younger patients it is most often caused by a sudden forceful pull on a tendon in the opposite direction of the bone movement. In the elderly it is associated with osteoporoticINSUFFICIENCY FRACTURES.

label: Femoral Fractures, Distal
scope_note: Fractures of the distalFEMURfrom the articular surface in theKNEEto the condylar region of the femur. A subset with a coronal-plane fracture of the distal femur condyle(s) is Hoffa Fracture.

label: Proximal Femoral Fractures
scope_note: Fractures of the proximalFEMURat theHIP.

label: Fractures, Closed
annotation: fract not causing an open wound; IM; coord with precoord organ/fract term (IM), as "closed fract of tibia" =FRACTURES, CLOSED(IM) +TIBIAL FRACTURES(IM); if no precoord organ/fract term is available, coord IM with organ/‌inj(IM), as "closed fract of fibula" =FRACTURES, CLOSED(IM) +FIBULA/‌inj(IM)
scope_note: Fractures in which the break in bone is not accompanied by an external wound.

label: Fractures, Comminuted
annotation: coordinate with specific bone/‌injor precoordinated Bone/Fracture term
scope_note: A fracture in which the bone is splintered or crushed into a number of pieces.

label: Fractures, Compression
annotation: CRUSH FRACTURESseeCRUSH INJURIESis also available
scope_note: Crumbling or smashing of cancellousBONEby forces acting parallel to the long axis of bone. It is applied particularly to vertebral body fractures (SPINAL FRACTURES). (Blauvelt and Nelson, A Manual of Orthopedic Terminology, 1994, p4)

label: Fractures, Malunited
annotation: do not confuse withFRACTURES, UNUNITED; coordinate with specific bone/‌injor precoordinated bone/fracture term
scope_note: Union of the fragments of a fractured bone in a faulty or abnormal position. If two bones parallel to one another unite by osseous tissue, the result is a crossunion. (From Manual of Orthopaedic Terminology, 4th ed)

label: Fractures, Multiple
scope_note: Injuries involving the breaking of either several bones or one bone in two or more places.

label: Fractures, Open
annotation: coordinate with specific bone/‌injor precoordinated Bone/Fracture term
scope_note: Fractures in which there is an external wound communicating with the break of the bone.

label: Fractures, Spontaneous
annotation: fract not caused by trauma; IM; coord with specific organ/‌injor organ/fract term (IM)
scope_note: Fractures occurring as a result of disease of a bone or from some undiscoverable cause, and not due to trauma. (Dorland, 27th ed)

label: Fractures, Stress
annotation: coordinate with specific organ/‌injor organ/fracture term; entry termFATIGUE FRACTURESrefers to bone fractures: do not use for metal fatigue as in fatigue fractures of amalgams, nails, screw plates, etc. (indexSTRESS, MECHANICAL)
scope_note: Fractures due to the strain caused by repetitive exercise. They are thought to arise from a combination ofMUSCLE FATIGUEand bone failure, and occur in situations whereBONE REMODELINGpredominates over repair. The most common sites of stress fractures are theMETATARSUS;FIBULA;TIBIA; andFEMORAL NECK.

label: Pseudarthrosis
annotation: a type of ununited fract; do not index underFRACTURES, UNUNITEDunless particularly discussed
scope_note: A pathologic entity characterized by deossification of a weight-bearing long bone, followed by bending and pathologic fracture, with inability to form normalBONY CALLUSleading to existence of the false joint that gives the condition its name. (Dorland, 27th ed)

label: Intra-Articular Fractures
scope_note: Fractures of the articular surface of a bone.

label: Patella Fracture
scope_note: Fractures of thePATELLA.

label: Tibial Plateau Fractures
scope_note: Fractures in the proximal portion of theTIBIAwhich acts as articular surface in theKNEE. They are often associated with knee ligament injuries (e.g.,ACL TEARS).

label: Osteoporotic Fractures
scope_note: Breaks in bones resulting from low bone mass and microarchitectural deterioration characteristic ofOSTEOPOROSIS.

label: Periprosthetic Fractures
scope_note: Fractures around joint replacement prosthetics or implants. They can occur intraoperatively or postoperatively.

label: Rib Fractures
scope_note: Fractures of any of theRIBS.

label: Bankart Lesions
scope_note: An anterior capsulolabral injury associated with a tear of the anteroinferiorGLENOID LABRUM.

label: Fractures, Cartilage
annotation: coordinate IM with specific type of cartilage/‌inj(IM)
scope_note: Breaks inCARTILAGE.

label: Finger Injuries
annotation: consider alsoTHUMB/‌inj
scope_note: General or unspecified injuries involving the fingers.

label: Heat Exhaustion
annotation: near normal body temperature: do not confuse withHEAT STROKEwhere body temp is dangerously high;SUNSTROKEis also available
scope_note: A clinical syndrome caused by heat stress, such as over-exertion in a hot environment or excessive exposure to sun. It is characterized bySWEATING, water (volume) depletion, salt depletion, cool clammy skin,NAUSEA, andHEADACHE.

label: Sunstroke
annotation: HEAT STROKEis also available
scope_note: Heat stroke caused by exposure to the sun. It is characterized by dangerously highBODY TEMPERATURE; red, hot skin;DELUSIONS;CONVULSIONS; orCOMA. It can be a life-threatening emergency and is most common in infants and the elderly.

label: Hyperthermia
scope_note: An abnormal elevation of body temperature, usually as a result of inability to regulate core body temperature due to non-pathologic factors.

label: Lacerations
scope_note: Torn, ragged, mangled wounds.

label: Anterior Cruciate Ligament Injuries
scope_note: Sprain or tear injuries to theANTERIOR CRUCIATE LIGAMENTof the knee.

label: Iliotibial Band Syndrome
scope_note: An overuse injury causing lateral knee pain that results from repetitive friction of the iliotibial band over the lateral femoral epicondyle.

label: Tibial Meniscus Injuries
scope_note: Injuries to theTIBIAL MENISCUSof the leg.

label: Microtrauma, Physical
scope_note: Small injuries caused by external force applied to the body including bones, muscles, nerves and tendons.

label: Whiplash Injuries
scope_note: Hyperextension injury to the neck, often the result of being struck from behind by a fast-moving vehicle, in an automobile accident. (From Segen, The Dictionary of Modern Medicine, 1992)

label: Occupational Injuries
annotation: coordinate with specific occupation and specific injury if pertinent
scope_note: Injuries sustained from incidents in the course of work-related activities.

label: Acute Radiation Syndrome
scope_note: A condition caused by a brief whole body exposure to more than one sievert dose equivalent of radiation. Acute radiation syndrome is initially characterized byANOREXIA;NAUSEA;VOMITING; but can progress to hematological, gastrointestinal, neurological, pulmonary, and other major organ dysfunction.

label: Neoplasms, Radiation-Induced
annotation: IM; coord with specific histol type (IM) and organ/neopl term (IM); Manual 24.4.3.2+
scope_note: Tumors, cancer or other neoplasms produced by exposure to ionizing or non-ionizing radiation.

label: Osteoradionecrosis
annotation: bone necrosis after radiation inj; coord IM with bone/dis (IM), not organ/‌inj
scope_note: Necrosis of bone following radiation injury.

label: Radiation Injuries, Experimental
annotation: for vertebrate animals only; "injuries" to insects, parasites, bacteria, viruses =RADIATION EFFECTS(general only) or specific organism/‌rad eff; Manual 28.12; radiations causing neoplasms =NEOPLASMS, RADIATION-INDUCEDorLEUKEMIA, RADIATION-INDUCED, causing abnormalities =ABNORMALITIES, RADIATION-INDUCED; DF: RAD INJ EXPER
scope_note: Experimentally produced harmful effects of ionizing or non-ionizingRADIATIONinCHORDATAanimals.

label: Reinjuries
scope_note: Damage inflicted on the same body part as a previous injury.

label: Rotator Cuff Injuries
scope_note: Injuries to theROTATOR CUFFof the shoulder joint.

label: Self Mutilation
annotation: SELF-INJURIOUS BEHAVIORis also available
scope_note: The act of injuring one's own body to the extent of cutting off or permanently destroying a limb or other essential part of a body.

label: Degloving Injuries
scope_note: Avulsions of the superficial tissues ofSKINandSUBCUTANEOUS TISSUEfrom the underlyingFASCIA.

label: Surgical Wound
scope_note: An incision made during a surgical procedure.

label: Flail Chest
scope_note: A complication of multipleRIB FRACTURES;RIBandSTERNUMfractures, or thoracic surgery. A portion of theTHORACIC WALLbecomes isolated from theRIB CAGEand exhibits paradoxical respiration.

label: Lung Injury
annotation: ACUTE LUNG INJURYandVENTILATOR-INDUCED LUNG INJURYare also available
scope_note: Damage to any compartment of the lung caused by physical, chemical, or biological agents which characteristically elicit inflammatory reaction. These inflammatory reactions can either be acute and dominated byNEUTROPHILS, or chronic and dominated byLYMPHOCYTESandMACROPHAGES.

label: Optic Nerve Injuries
scope_note: Injuries to the optic nerve induced by a trauma to the face or head. These may occur with closed or penetrating injuries. Relatively minor compression of the superior aspect of orbit may also result in trauma to the optic nerve. Clinical manifestations may include visual loss,PAPILLEDEMA, and an afferent pupillary defect.

label: Wounds, Gunshot
annotation: coord IM with organ/‌inj(IM) or precoord inj term (IM);FORENSIC BALLISTICSis also available
scope_note: Disruption of structural continuity of the body as a result of the discharge of firearms.

label: Needlestick Injuries
annotation: IM; coord with organ/inj or precoord inj term (IM)
scope_note: Penetrating stab wounds caused by needles. They are of special concern to health care workers since such injuries put them at risk for developing infectious disease.
